```{python}
#| label: fig-current-mirror-reg-casc-lv
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "A low-voltage regulated-cascode current mirror. The differential common-gate error amplifier is used to keep the drain voltage of the bottom transistors constant, thus improving the current mirroring accuracy and output resistance."
import schemdraw as sd
import schemdraw.elements as elm
sd.svgconfig.svg2 = False
with sd.Drawing(canvas='svg') as d:
    d.config(unit=2)
    d.config(fontsize=16)

    ibias1 = elm.SourceI().down().label(r'$I_\mathrm{bias1}$').dot()
    res = elm.Resistor().down().dot().label('$R$')
    M3 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).drop('source').theta(0).label('$W_2/L_2$')
    elm.Line().down(d.unit)
    M1 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).drop('source').theta(0).label('$W_1/L_1$')
    elm.Ground()
    elm.Line().right(d.unit/4).at(M1.gate).dot()
    elm.Line().up().toy(res.end)
    elm.Line().left().to(res.end)

    elm.Line().right().at(M1.gate).length(d.unit*4)
    M2 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('gate').drop('drain').theta(0).reverse().label(r'$k \cdot W_1/L_1$', ofst=-2.8)
    elm.Line().up(d.unit)
    M4 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('source').theta(0).reverse().label(r'$k \cdot W_2/L_2$', ofst=-2.8)
    elm.Ground().at(M2.source)
    elm.Line().at(M4.drain).up().length(d.unit).dot(open=True).label(r'$I_\mathrm{out} = k \cdot I_\mathrm{bias1}$', 'right')

    elm.Line().right(d.unit*3/4).at(M3.gate)
    elm.Line().up().toy(res.start)
    elm.Line().left().to(res.start)

    # auxiliary amplifier
    elm.Line().at(M4.gate).left(d.unit).dot().color('blue')
    Maux1 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('drain').theta(0).drop('source').reverse().color('blue')
    elm.Line().down(d.unit*2/4).color('blue')
    elm.Line().left().tox(M1.drain).dot().color('blue')
    elm.Line().left(d.unit/4).at(Maux1.gate).color('blue').dot()
    d.push()
    elm.Line().left(d.unit/4).color('blue')
    Maux2 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('gate').theta(0).drop('source').color('blue')
    elm.Line().down(d.unit*1/4).color('blue')
    elm.Line().right().tox(M2.drain).dot().color('blue')
    d.pop()
    elm.Line().up().toy(Maux2.drain).color('blue')
    elm.Line().to(Maux2.drain).dot().color('blue')
    ibias2 = elm.SourceI().at(Maux1.drain).up().toy(ibias1.start).reverse().label(r'$I_\mathrm{bias3}$').color('blue')
    ibias3 = elm.SourceI().at(Maux2.drain).up().toy(ibias1.start).reverse().label(r'$I_\mathrm{bias2}$').color('blue')

    # vdd line
    elm.Line().at((ibias1.start[0]-d.unit/4, ibias1.start[1])).to((ibias2.end[0]+d.unit/4, ibias2.end[1])).label(r'$V_\mathrm{DD}$').linewidth(3)
```
